A: 1. Insects damaging farm crops are called _ (a) Useful (b) Harmful (c) Pests
2. Farm insects include _ and _ (a) Weevil, Mosquitoes (b) Ants, Cockroach (c) Locust, Termites
3. What causes sickness to animals? (a) Typhoid (b) Malaria (c) Harmful insects
4. Some pests are parasites (a) True (b) False
5. Pests affect _ (a) Crops, Animals (b) Humans (c) Classrooms
6. Pests causing crop damage are _ and _ (a) Rodents, Beetles (b) Frog, Toad (c) Lion, Elephant
7. Some pests damage crops on the _ (a) Road (b) Farm (c) Grass
8. Some pests attack stored _ (a) Crops (b) Books (c) Desk
9. A _ lives on other organisms (a) Solid food (b) Other organisms (c) Fats and oil
10. They live on their _ (a) Guests (b) Visitors (c) Hosts
11. Their _ suffers and may die (a) Passenger (b) Hosts (c) Hostess
12. Parasites include _ and _ (a) Lice, Tsetse fly (b) Mosquitoes, Fly (c) Wall gecko, electric ant
13. _ farm products before storing (a) Air fry (b) Dry (c) Fan
14. Prevent _ water around the house (a) Rain (b) Well (c) Stagnant
15. _ our surroundings to keep it clean (a) Destroy (b) Kill (c) Clear
16. An _ lives inside the soil (a) Earthworm (b) Guinea fowl (c) Hippopotamus
17. _ is known as a farmer's friend (a) Dog (b) Earthworm (c) Lion
18. _ and _ are farmer's enemies (a) Turkey, chicken (b) Moth, caterpillar (c) Rodents, birds
19. Rodents include _ and _ (a) Grass cutter, Rats (b) Cockroach, Insects (c) Lion, Scorpion
20. Birds include _ (a) Orangutan (b) Hawk (c) Rats
